question: 証人
sourceMnemonic: An <kanji>evidence</kanji> <kanji>person</kanji> is a <vocabulary>witness</vocabulary>, because witnesses are people who provide evidence (you know, with their mouths or something).
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
